data.title: St. Charles East High School
data.text:
My passion for St. Charles East is also rooted in my family life. My wife and four children often accompany me to sporting events, theater performances, and club/activity events. I am proud that they have witnessed the spirit of our students and the pride they take in being Saints.

It is imperative for families and high schools to form partnerships with the goal of supporting students as they strive to reach their goals. I look forward to working with you and encourage you to reach out to me at any time. I am committed to making your child’s high school experience the best it can possibly be!

Contact Principal Richter

Assistant Principal - Kim Kereluik

I am excited to serve the St. Charles East High School and District 303 community as the Assistant Principal of Student Services. In this position, my work will focus on supporting students’ academic and social-emotional needs through various interventions and programs that are available at East. I oversee and support students that may need additional academic and/or social-emotional support through various interventions by working with the Special Ed Department, school psychologists, social workers, student support specialists, and the student support assistance counselor.

I spent 11 years at East Aurora High School as a Special Education Coordinator and prior to that was a self-contained ED/BD teacher at a private therapeutic school and West Aurora High School.

I graduated from Roosevelt University with my BA in Special Education (2005), Concordia University with my MA in Educational Leadership (2010), and Concordia University with a MA in Curriculum and Instruction with a focus on Trauma and Resiliency (2022).

I am excited to work with the students, parents, teachers, and community members that are pivotal to East High’s success.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns. Go Saints!

Contact Kim Kereluik

Assistant Principal - Matt Jeffrey

I am excited to return to my alma mater, St. Charles East High School, and the District 303 Community as the Assistant Principal of Instructional Programs. The Office of Instructional Programs collaborates with the Principal in overseeing curriculum and assessment development, academic placement, and scheduling. The primary focus of our Instructional Programs Department places an emphasis on collaborating with our teacher leaders and staff to continue to enhance and improve the educational experiences of our students.

Prior to coming to St. Charles East, I most recently served as the Principal of Partners for Success (the DuPage Regional Office of Education Safe School 6th-12th grades). For over twenty years, I’ve been fortunate to serve in a variety of roles as an administrator at the High School, Middle School, and Elementary School levels. My educational career started here in District 303, where I taught Social Studies at Haines Middle School for six years, and coached wrestling and baseball at St. Charles High School, and then St. Charles East High School, before moving into school leadership.

I have a Bachelors of Science in Social Studies Secondary Education from Taylor University and two Master's Degrees, from Aurora University (one in Educational Leadership and another in Teaching with a focus in Curriculum and Instruction).

I am ecstatic to have the opportunity to return to St. Charles East High School. I am most looking forward to collaborating with the staff at East and building new relationships with students, parents, and community members to provide the best possible experience at St. Charles East High School. If there is anything that I can do to help support your student please don’t hesitate to contact me. Go Saints! ⚜️

Contact Matt Jeffrey

Assistant Principal - Lisa Dandre

Welcome to Student Life at St. Charles East High! The Student Life Department includes all clubs and activities, the building and operations, and the Dean’s Office. Our primary purpose is to encourage students to get involved and make positive, healthy choices while in high school. We organize recognition assemblies, dances, and service projects for the entire student body. We support our students by offering activities that promote the core values of service, leadership, and community as they strive for academic excellence. Each day we work to create a safe and secure environment that allows all students to reach their potential. We believe that students “don’t care how much we know, until they know how much we care”. Student Life cares!

I started teaching at St. Charles High School in 1993. I was a Business Education teacher for nineteen years and an Instructional Support Coach for four years. I was part of the Upstate 8 as a high school student - a Lake Park Lancer. I have a Bachelors of Science degree in Organizational Management from Elmhurst College and a Masters of Arts in Secondary Education from Roosevelt University. I completed my Administrator Certificate/Type 75 coursework at Aurora University. I am looking forward to another year as Assistant Principal for Student Life at St. Charles East High. It’s a special place to work! I value feedback and welcome new ideas. I can’t wait to learn and work with you and your son/daughter this year!

Thanks for taking the time to read about me and the Student Life Department. Remember, it’s always a great day to be a Saint!

Contact Lisa Dandre

Assistant Principal - Matt Gill

Education & Experience: I earned my Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 1995 and my Master of Arts in Educational Administration from Governors State University in 2003. I have ten years of classroom experience as a social studies teacher at St. Rita (Chicago) and Wheaton-Warrenville South High Schools. I have twelve years of administrative experience as Dean of Students at Wheaton North and St. Charles East High Schools. I have been serving in my current role as Assistant Principal for College & Career Readiness since July 1, 2017.

Primary Focus: I work with the College & Career Readiness team to support our students with their academics, course planning, career exploration, college search and application process, post-high school career planning and social-emotional concerns. I also serve as the site coordinator for our AVID program and act as the administrative liaison to the Social Studies Department. Please visit our College & Career Readiness website under the Students tab for resources and information.

Contact Matt Gill

Dean of Students – Shawn Burke

Students (Han-Pat)

I started my career in education as a PE Teacher at Martino Jr. High in New Lenox, IL. While teaching, I worked on completing my Master’s Degree in Educational Administration from Northern Illinois University. After 7 years of teaching, I was given the opportunity to become the Assistant Principal/Dean of Students at Plano High School in Plano, IL before coming to St. Charles East as a Dean of Students. My goal is to help all students achieve their fullest potential, academically and socially, while navigating their high school careers.

Having been at St. Charles East since 2003, I have seen many changes in the culture and climate of our staff and students but the one thing that has never changed is the focus on our students’ success. This is truly a special place and as the saying goes – No matter where you go, the sun always rises in the East.

Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns about your student and I will do my best to help in any way I can.

Contact Shawn Burke

Dean of Students – Nicole Osborne

Students (A – Ham)

Greetings, Saints!

I am honored to be part of the East Administrative team serving as Dean of Students (A-Ham). In my role, I act as a supportive individual for student growth and learning. I have one intention: to do what is best for students. Together, we do better. Students encounter a gamut of educational experiences. Sometimes those experiences require a team for support, and we must be open to communication and collaboration to achieve success. Therefore, I look forward to the work we -students, parents, faculty, and staff -will accomplish.

I began my educational career in 2004. I earned my Bachelor of Arts degree in English with a minor in Spanish from Eastern Illinois University. I spent the majority of my career in several suburban high schools: Bolingbrook, Glenbard East, and West Chicago. After eighteen years in the classroom, I returned to DePaul to work on a second Master’s degree in Educational Leadership & Administration. As an administrator, before St. Charles East, I served as Assistant Principal at Genoa-Kingston High School. I hope to finish my Ph.D. in Curriculum Studies next year.

I look forward to a great year ahead. Please contact me so that I can better support your student.

Contact Nicole Osborne
